The event involves a virtual treasure with the help of VR Headset kits where the participants will have to find the hidden treasure in the VR Model and will be timed. The winners will be chosen based on the quickest to figure out the hidden treasures/objects. The game will slightly resemble a variant of a virtual easter egg.

fields.eventName: Prompt Engineering 101: Building the Future of Business
fields.shortDescription: A talk focused on introducing prompt engineering concepts to budding entrepreneurs. The session will guide participants through the process of using AI-driven tools to enhance business strategy and decision-making. The event aims to foster creativity, critical thinking, and innovation, while providing actionable insights into applying prompt engineering for business growth.

A business case study competition where participants analyze real-world business problems and present practical, innovative solutions. The event aims to enhance strategic thinking, problem-solving, and presentation skills among participants.

A business case study competition where participants analyze real-world business problems and present practical, innovative solutions. The event aims to enhance strategic thinking, problem-solving, and presentation skills among participants.

Step into a high-stakes world where a powerful corporation hides its darkest secrets. Project X is an interactive debate-meets-tech challenge where participants investigate a staged corporate cover-up. Teams will interrogate witnesses, uncover digital evidence, and hack through simulated firewalls to reveal the truth. With three thrilling rounds — The Interrogation Gauntlet, The Data Heist, and The Press Conference — this event blends sharp debating skills with technical forensics. Do you have what it takes to expose the truth or defend the indefensible?

A Model-UN style debate where each participant represents a country and deliberates on the pressing agenda: “Artificial Intelligence and Surveillance: Balancing National Security with the Right to Privacy.” The event will encourage critical thinking, negotiation, and global policy discussion on how nations can leverage AI for security without compromising fundamental human rights.

LaserTag is a thrilling 5v5 arena game where you race to score the most points with laser guns against opponents. Surrounded by glowing UV lights, lasers, and vibrant artwork, the arena creates a fun, competitive vibe. Safe, beginner-friendly, and adrenaline-packed, it’s an experience you won’t forget. Step in, gear up, and let the battle begin!

24 hour all women hackathon based on sustainable development goals. The Women Development Cell (WDC) of VIT Chennai, in collaboration with HackClub, proudly presents a 24-Hour All-Women Hackathon as part of TechnoVIT.

This hackathon is more than just coding-it is about women paving the way for future tech. It proves that women are not only capable of excelling in hardcore tech, but also of leading the global conversation on sustainability. 
Centered around the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs), the event challenges participants to innovate, design, and develop impactful solutions that address some of the world’s most pressing issues.

Over 24 hours, brilliant women innovators will collaborate to create tech-driven solutions that advance sustainability while redefining what it means to be in technology. This is not just a hackathon-it’s a movement toward inclusivity, equality, and a sustainable future.

Cad-a-thon is an engaging online design challenge where participants showcase creativity and technical skills using AutoCAD. Each round begins with a prompt — such as designing a public space, building, or functional layout — and participants must create accurate CAD drawings based on it. Along with the drawing, a short description highlighting the concept, purpose, and design choices must be submitted. The event encourages innovative thinking, practical problem-solving, and precision in design. Open to students, aspiring architects, and design enthusiasts, Cad-a-thon is judged on creativity, functionality, technical accuracy, and clarity, making it the ultimate test of design imagination.
A event where we’ll providing the participants with LEDs,resistors and Arduino UNO, the team with the most creative design of LEDs desigining will be the winner

People familiar and interested in blender are given a free hand for their creativities based on selective themes and will be judged by 3D modeling department of the club based on their skills, creativity and proficiency of Blender Software.

Join VITSOL's Youth Parliament 2025! A simulated debate for students on national & global issues. 🏛️ Draft resolutions and engage in dialogue to develop critical thinking, public speaking, and policy awareness.
fields.longDescription: The Youth Parliament 2025, organized by the VITSOL Debate Society, is a dynamic platform for students to engage in simulated parliamentary debates on pressing national and global issues. Designed to foster critical thinking, policy awareness, and public speaking, the event encourages participants to voice diverse perspectives, draft resolutions, and experience the spirit of democratic dialogue. Through rigorous debate and collaboration, young minds will learn not just to argue; but to understand, persuade, and lead.

fields.shortDescription: This event is aimed at consideration of advanced AI and ML in the global market and industrial prospective which is interesting for the large audience.
Digital detox - workshop for students to detox from digital addiction to enhance productivity and time management, which will result in stress reduction and mental health recovery.

fields.shortDescription: Join VØID:v1, a 24-hour hackathon where technology meets entrepreneurship. Go beyond coding to build a functional prototype and a comprehensive business plan, turning visionary ideas into viable businesses across diverse innovation tracks.
fields.longDescription:
VØID:v1 is built for the restless and the bold - those who refuse to watch the future unfold and instead choose to shape it. Scheduled for 28th & 29th October 2025, this 24-hour hackathon is more than just a coding competition. It is an arena where creativity collides with technology, where ideas roar louder than Wall Street, and where teams don't just build projects - they spark movements. 

VOID is an innovation-focused hackathon where top minds converge to build groundbreaking, disruptive solutions. It's more than just a coding competition; it's a platform for turning visionary ideas into viable businesses. Participants will not only create groundbreaking, functional prototypes but will also develop comprehensive business plans, including pitch decks and Business Model Canvases (BMCs), preparing them for real-world application. VOID is where technology meets entrepreneurship, creating a future-ready cohort of innovators.

Powered by the Open Source Programming Club (OSPC) and the Business Innovation Club (BIC) of VIT Chennai, and hosted on Devfolio, VØID provides the perfect platform to showcase talent, collaborate with like-minded peers, and turn visionary ideas into tangible, game-changing outcomes.

🌐 Tracks:
1. FinTech & Digital Payments
2. HealthTech & EdTech
3. RetailTech, SaaS & Smart Mobility
4. AgriTech & SDG
5. Open Innovation

fields.eventName: Under the Cosmic Canopy: Stargazing Night
fields.shortDescription: Join us for a night beneath the stars! Explore the universe through high-powered telescopes. Guided by enthusiasts, you’ll learn to operate them and witness the magic of the night sky firsthand. An evening of awe and discovery awaits.

fields.eventName: The Royale : from Data to Depth(squad)
fields.shortDescription: This multi-round event features a workshop on all three tiers of ML, followed by quizzes. Participants then tackle a unique problem-solving challenge in a final competition, with a live scoreboard tracking progress to determine the winner.
fields.longDescription:
The event is of Multiple rounds , a workshop covering all three tiers of ML(supervised , unsupervised , reinforcement learning) , followed by a competition round . The final challenge has an ambiguous challenge that involves unique problem solving .
 between these rounds , quizzes will be conducted to reinforce understanding brfore advancing further . 
 a realtime score board will be presented as and when the participants build their project , the winner will be declared and be awarded with prize money .

fields.shortDescription: Explore AI from fundamentals to deep learning in this hands-on workshop. Cover neural networks, NLP, and more through live coding and real-world projects. Learn to wield AI as a tool to build intelligent systems and solve modern challenges.

fields.eventVenue: Clock Court, MBA Amphi, AB1 Portico, AB3 Portico, AB1 Side Entrance, AB1 Mini Portico, AB3 First Floor Classroom, Outside/Near MG, and AB3 Amphi (Back Side) (Multiple checkpoints throughout the campus)
fields.shortDescription: Techno Prix is a campus-wide event where teams of 4 navigate checkpoints, tackling challenges that test entrepreneurship and strategy. Compete in activities like Shark Tank pitches, SDG card trading, and meme marketing to win.
fields.longDescription:
Techno Prix is an interactive, campus-wide event designed to foster entrepreneurship, strategic thinking, collaborative problem-solving, and innovation among students. Teams of four will navigate a series of 10 checkpoints across the campus, participating in challenges that combine business creativity, negotiation, and gameplay.
 
 Participants will engage in activities such as:
 -Shark Tank Mini: Pitch creative business ideas to earn investment points.
 -SDG Deck Trade: Strategically negotiate and collect Sustainable Development Goal cards to maximize rewards.
 -Reverse Shark Tank: Present unconventional or humorous business ideas persuasively.
 -Customer Chaos Challenge: Demonstrate adaptability and sales skills by addressing unique customer demands.
 -Meme Marketing Mayhem: Develop marketing content for given products, emphasizing creativity and engagement.
 -GDG GameDev PlayZone: Experience and compete in games created by the GameDev team, earning points and advantages through interactive gameplay.
 
 The event aims to encourage entrepreneurial thinking, creativity, teamwork, and campus-wide interaction, while maintaining an enjoyable and competitive environment.
 
 Team Composition: 4 members per team
 Venue: Multiple checkpoints across the campus

fields.shortDescription: ScriptWave is a hands-on hackathon where teams tackle scripting and verification challenges. Create scripts, build testbenches,and debug digital designs to gain practical experience with industry tools in a collaborative, problem-solving environment.
fields.longDescription: ScriptWave is a hands-on hackathon where participants dive into scripting and verification challenges to test and validate digital designs. Teams will create scripts, build testbenches, and debug solutions in a collaborative environment, gaining practical experience with industry-relevant tools and methodologies. The event emphasizes problem-solving, innovation, and efficiency, giving participants a real taste of digital design verification in action.

fields.shortDescription: Join a workshop on Scripting and Verification in VLSI Design, led by a VIT Chennai faculty member. This session provides practical exposure to industry-relevant scripting techniques and verification methodologies used in modern VLSI design flows.
fields.longDescription: A Workshop on Scripting and Verification in VLSI Design and Technology will be conducted by a faculty member from VIT Chennai. The session will focus on scripting techniques, verification methodologies, and their applications in modern VLSI design flows. It is aimed at providing participants with both conceptual understanding and practical exposure to industry-relevant practices.

fields.shortDescription: Students in teams of 4, guided by a mentor, will build a phone-controlled RC car with a servo-operated pick and drop system using 3D printed parts. They'll then compete in a championship to move blocks across a terrain in the shortest time.

fields.eventName: Power in the Air: Wireless Energy Make-a-Thon
fields.shortDescription: This workshop and Make-a-Thon focuses on wireless power transfer. ⚡ You'll learn the science behind air-cored coupled inductors, then design, build, and compete with your own prototypes to transfer electricity through the air.
fields.longDescription: Experience the future of power! This workshop and Make-a-Thon will guide you through designing air-cored coupled inductors to achieve electricity transfer through air. Learn the science, build your own prototypes, and compete with peers in creating innovative wireless power solutions. Gen Z innovation meets real-world energy transfer!

fields.shortDescription: In this competition, the task is to design, test, and gamify prompts that push AI systems to perform in creative, challenging, and unexpected ways.

🚀 T Minus Zero: Model Rocketry- Get ready to ignite your passion for space! In this thrilling, hands-on event, students dive into the science of rocketry, design and build their own model rockets, and watch them soar sky-high during live launches. The best part? You get to take your very own rocket home—a souvenir of your first step into the world of rocketry!

fields.eventName: Personal Finance Workshop for Young Adults (Duo)
fields.shortDescription: This 4-5 hour workshop for young adults (18–23) teaches essential money skills often missed in college. Through interactive activities, you’ll learn budgeting, banking, CIBIL scores, beginner investing, and taxes, leaving with a 30-day action plan.
fields.longDescription:
The Personal Finance Workshop for Young Adults is a 4–5 hour interactive session designed to equip students and early-career individuals (ages 18–23) with essential money-management skills that schools and colleges often overlook. Through engaging activities, games, and practical worksheets, participants will learn how to budget effectively, manage cash flow, understand banking and digital finance in India, build and improve their CIBIL scores, explore beginner-friendly investment options like SIPs and mutual funds, and grasp the basics of taxation and insurance. The workshop also focuses on developing positive financial habits, with a 30-day action plan to put concepts into practice. By the end, attendees will gain not just financial knowledge but also actionable strategies, confidence, and a clear roadmap to take charge of their money and build long-term financial independence.
 
 https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Vin4m2pyALK8fzGnrhsA4E63QgTHQiNn/edit?usp=sharing&ouid=110921576229861351143&rtpof=true&sd=true

fields.shortDescription: A hands-on workshop covering the end-to-end **PCB** process. 💡 Participants learn to design circuits using software like **KiCad/Eagle**, fabricate boards through etching and drilling, and assemble them by soldering components.
fields.longDescription: A PCB workshop is a hands-on session where participants learn how to design, fabricate, and assemble electronic circuits on a PCB. This workshop covers the basics of electronics, circuit design using software tools like KiCad or Eagle, and the manufacturing process, including etching, drilling, and soldering components.

fields.shortDescription: Join our single-stage hackathon on **VLSI and general electronics**! 🚀 Participants will choose a problem statement on the event day. Solutions will be judged on **innovation, creativity, and originality** by a panel of faculty and students.
fields.longDescription: Hackathon with problem statements on VLSI and general electronics. A single stage hackathon in which participants will be given problem statements to choose from on the day. They will then be judged based on multiple criteria such as innovation, creativity, originality etc by a mix of faculty and students.

fields.eventName: International Online Workshop & 24 hours Netsim Hackathon
fields.shortDescription: This event is a International Online team event supported by Tetcos, Bangalore and IEEE photonics society.   Team Size is restricted to a minimum of 2 members to maximum of 3 members.  This event is primarily targeted for UG students who has essential knowledge or interests in Computer Networks. NetSim by Tetcos is a powerful network simulation software used to design, analyze, and visualize communication networks An online workshop familiarizes participants with hands-on network modeling and performance analysis using NetSim. The 24-hour online hackathon engages students in real-time problem-solving and innovation through multi-round simulation and debugging challenges.

This is a 3-stage tech escape challenge! 🔐 Stage 1: Solve resistor and Python puzzles for a 3-digit key. Stage 2: Use a UV light to find a hidden schematic and complete a physical circuit. Stage 3: Decrypt a hex command for the final password.
fields.longDescription:
Stage 1: The Technical Key: Participants begin by searching for clues to unlock a secured component box. The solution is not a simple number, but a 3-digit code derived from technical knowledge: interpreting resistor color codes from a schematic, calculating the output of a Python programming snippet, and identifying a standard secure network port.
• Stage 2: The Circuit Completion: Using a UV light, teams will uncover a hidden, incomplete circuit diagram. Their task is to correctly interpret the schematic and use physical wires to complete the circuit on the main prototype device, demonstrating a practical understanding of electronic pathways.
• Stage 3: The Hexadecimal Override: The finale requires teams to decrypt a hexadecimal command key displayed on the prototype's screen. Using a provided Hex-to-ASCII chart, they must translate the machine code into a final password, simulating a system override.

fields.shortDescription: Join the Cloud Ops Club's Idea Challenge! Analyze global solutions to societal issues, adapt them for India, and build tech prototypes like data visualizations or AI. Collaborate and innovate for change.
fields.longDescription:
Join us for a dynamic Idea Challenge, in collaboration with the Cloud Ops Club, where participants explore how countries like France and India have tackled societal and developmental issues. Using a case study approach, you’ll analyze successful international models and creatively reimagine them to fit India’s unique cultural, economic, and policy landscape—without comparison or judgment.
 
 This challenge also includes a technical dimension, encouraging you to transform ideas into practical, tech-enabled solutions such as data analysis, interactive visualizations, digital prototypes, or AI-driven simulations. Collaborate, innovate, and build impactful solutions through cross-cultural learning and constructive problem-solving.

fields.shortDescription: Explore your inner world in this immersive face art competition. Generate a unique emotional prompt using AI or introspection. Transform your face into a canvas of healing and expression, interpreting yourself through color, symbolism, and design.

Join Hackatronics, a 24-hour hackathon with separate hardware and software tracks. Tackle diverse challenges in areas like IoT, healthcare, and ML. Ideate, design, and build solutions under pressure, and gain insights from an industry expert.

Become a digital guardian in our cyber defense workshop. Learn Linux essentials, networking, web vulnerabilities, and OSINT strategies with hands-on tools. Test your new skills in a final Capture-the-Flag (CTF) battle.

fields.eventName: The Escape room Psych Lab lockdown
fields.shortDescription: A group of psychologists are trapped in a lab by their superiors. Forced to cooperate, they must overcome their differences and retrieve vital information to escape the deafening silence and the lab's confines.
Design miniature costumes for emotional storytelling. Use AI to generate mood-based color palettes and motifs. Present your final creation and its emotional concept in a mini-exhibition.

With a focus on the future of devices, this event seeks to highlight how advancements in semiconductor technology, quantum devices, flexible electronics, and AI-integrated systems are redefining industries and society.

fields.shortDescription: Tackle a simple engineering design problem in ECE, EEE, or CSE. Your challenge is to create a theoretical design, build a mandatory hardware prototype on a breadboard or PCB, and validate your results using simulation software.
fields.longDescription:
Students will be given a simple engineering design problem related to Electrical, Electronics, Communication and Computer Engineering. Interested others may also join.
 
 Students have to identify the system, make a theoretical design, identify the components required and make a hardware prototype (mandatory) using breadboard or general purpose pcb. The results of the prototype shall be validated using any simulation software.

fields.shortDescription: Quiz on environmental technologies—covering topics like green buildings, electric vehicles, renewable energy, and waste management. The quiz includes a mix of picture identifications, MCQs, rapid-fire rounds, and fun knowledge-building challenges
fields.longDescription: Quiz on environmental technologies—covering topics like green buildings, electric vehicles, renewable energy, and waste management. The quiz should include a mix of picture identifications, MCQs, rapid-fire rounds, and fun knowledge-building challenges

fields.eventName: Digital Marketing Workshop - Pitch your ideas to Products
fields.shortDescription: Hands on session for Mastering in Digital marketing techniques by building ideas to product.
fields.longDescription: Hands on session for Mastering in Digital marketing techniques by building ideas to product.

fields.shortDescription: This is a 2-phase CAD challenge! ⚙️ Phase 1 is a technical quiz on CAD and engineering fundamentals. Qualified teams advance to Phase 2, where they must create a complete 3D model from a 2D sketch. The highest combined score from both phases wins.
fields.longDescription:
A combination of quiz followed by a cad modelling challenge. The event will be conducted in two phases:

Phase 1 – Technical Quiz
Participants will face a quiz round focused on CAD concepts and core engineering fundamentals. Teams will be awarded points based on the accuracy and quality of their answers.

Phase 2 – 3D Modeling Challenge
Qualified teams will be provided with a 2D sketch containing multiple views. Using this as reference, they must create a complete 3D model from scratch. The model’s precision, accuracy, and adherence to the given sketch will determine the points awarded.

The team with the highest combined score from both phases will be declared the winner.

fields.shortDescription: "Talk the Talk" blends tech knowledge with fun communication games. 🎤 Compete in Tech Taboo, Pitch an Object, quick-fire debates, and meme presentations. It's the perfect platform for techies and speakers to test their wit.
fields.longDescription:
Step into a world where technology meets creativity, and ideas come alive through games and laughter! Talk the Talk is a one-of-a-kind event that blends technical wit with spontaneous communication challenges.

Get ready for:
Tech Taboo – explain technical jargon without the obvious buzzwords.
Pitch an Object – sell a pen, a bottle, or even a slipper as if it’s the next big tech invention.
404 Error – guess the hidden technical term before your time runs out.
Reverse Engineering – decode quirky product descriptions to reveal the invention.
Tech Debate Showdown – battle it out on fun, geeky topics in quick-fire debates.
Meme the Machine – turn memes into epic mini-presentations.
Whether you’re a techie, a speaker, or just someone who loves a good laugh, this event has something for you. Come join us, test your wit, and most importantly—Talk the Talk

fields.shortDescription: In Code Golf, solve coding problems with the shortest possible code. Every character counts in this high-energy challenge. The winner is the one who writes the leanest, most elegant solution in a battle of logic, creativity, and brevity.
fields.longDescription: Code Golf is a high-energy coding challenge where participants must solve problems with the shortest possible code. Every character counts, and the winner is the one who trims their logic down to the leanest, most elegant solution. It’s a battle of logic, creativity, and brevity—where less truly is more.

fields.shortDescription: In this hands-on workshop, you'll become a web architect. 💻 Master the core blocks—**HTML, CSS, & JavaScript**—before advancing to responsive design and frontend frameworks. You'll learn modern best practices by building real-world projects.
fields.longDescription:
The digital empire of tomorrow rests in the hands of its builders. This workshop empowers you to become an architect of the web, starting from the core building blocks — HTML, CSS, and JavaScript — to advanced frameworks and responsive design. You’ll work on real-world projects, learn modern best practices, and craft websites that are not just functional but breathtaking. Create experiences that leave a mark.
 Highlights: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Responsive Design, Frontend Frameworks, Hands-on Project Building.

fields.shortDescription: Code & Conquer Game-a-thon, where strategy meets skill in the ultimate gaming challenge!
fields.longDescription: Code & Conquer Game-a-thon, where strategy meets skill in the ultimate gaming challenge!

fields.shortDescription: Circuit-A-Thon is a fast-paced hardware buildathon where teams design and demo circuits (analog, mixed-signal, IoT, FPGA). With guided checkpoints, mentor hours, and on-bench testing, participants turn ideas into measurable, demo-ready prototypes.
fields.longDescription: Circuit-A-Thon is a fast-paced hardware buildathon where teams design, prototype, and demo working electronic circuits—from analog front-ends and mixed-signal blocks to embedded/IoT systems and FPGA logic. Guided checkpoints, mentor hours, and on-bench testing help participants turn ideas into measurable, demo-ready prototypes.

fields.shortDescription: In this "Shark Tank" style event, aspiring directors fix an underperforming movie. 🎬 Dissect its flaws and pitch a new vision—covering story, characters, and visuals—to judges acting as producers. Negotiate to secure the most profitable deal.
fields.longDescription:
This event is based on shark tank where the business owners are replaced by aspiring young directors and the sharks are producers who are willing to finance their movies.
Our event's main focus is for aspiring young directors to gain more knowledge on what goes behind making a successful movie.
As part of the event, we will be giving them each a movie which they will have to dissect and understand which part caused the movie's underperformance.
Further when they pitch the movie with their inputs to everything from the storyline, characters, camera aesthetics and sound effects.
Now the new upgraded version of the movie will be narrated by them to the judges and negotiate with them and try to exceed the break-even amount thus making more profit making them the champion.

fields.shortDescription: Capture the FlagDroid is a developer-style CTF. Solve development challenges to find hidden flags that double as parts of a .env file. Only teams that collect every flag can successfully deploy their application and win the competition.
fields.longDescription: Capture the FlagDroid is an innovative developer-style CTF where participants advance through a series of development challenges, each revealing a hidden flag that earns them points. The competition combines traditional Capture the Flag mechanics, hands-on development, and engaging bonus twists to create a challenging and educational experience. Each flag includes fun and interactive elements and also represents a part of the project’s .env file, so only teams that collect all the flags can successfully deploy their application.

fields.shortDescription: This practical cinematography session teaches you to shoot like a pro. 🎥 Master essential camera skills like framing, panning, zooming, and stability, along with lighting, angles, and shot composition to capture truly cinematic stories.
fields.longDescription: Before you can direct your masterpiece, you need to learn how to handle the camera like a pro. In this practical session, you’ll master framing, panning, zooming, and stability- everything needed to shoot a scene like Scorsese or Nolan. With guidance on lighting, angles, and shot composition, you’ll be ready to capture stories that feel truly cinematic.

fields.eventName: AIdeas in Fashion: The Poster Challenge
fields.shortDescription: In this visionary competition, conceptualize a fashion product rooted in emotional intelligence, healing, and AI. Showcase your innovation in a brochure detailing its development process, brand identity, and sustainable design.
AI based game development tool

Unleash your creativity in our tote bag design workshop! Transform a plain bag into a unique masterpiece using block printing, fabric markers, and vibrant paints. This hands-on session promotes sustainability and artistic expression. No prior experience is needed!

Use PlanSwift for quantity surveying to perform take-offs directly from digital drawings (PDFs/CAD). This streamlines Bill of Quantities (BOQ) preparation, boosting accuracy and reducing manual errors for civil, structural, and MEP works.
fields.longDescription: "Quantity Surveying with PlanSwift" refers to using the PlanSwift software to perform quantity take-offs for construction projects, which streamlines the Bill of Quantities (BOQ) preparation by directly measuring elements from digital drawings like PDFs and CAD files. This technique enhances efficiency and accuracy, benefiting quantity surveyors by reducing manual errors in estimating material quantities for civil, structural, and MEP (Mechanical, Electrical, and Plumbing) works

fields.shortDescription: Interactive event designed to teach participants the practical skills of designing and fabricating electronic circuits on PCB platforms.
fields.longDescription: Interactive event designed to teach participants the practical skills of designing and fabricating electronic circuits on PCB platforms.

fields.shortDescription: Interactive event designed to teach participants the practical skills of designing and fabricating electronic circuits on PCB platforms.

fields.shortDescription: Interactive event designed to teach participants the practical skills of designing and fabricating electronic circuits on PCB platforms.
fields.longDescription: Interactive event designed to teach participants the practical skills of designing and fabricating electronic circuits on PCB platforms.

fields.shortDescription: In this on-campus digital treasure hunt, teams of 1-4 will learn Open Source Intelligence (OSINT). Follow online and offline clues using cybersecurity skills to reach a finale where your choices determine how you find a missing person.
fields.longDescription:
An engaging, on-campus digital treasure hunt designed to introduce participants to Open Source Intelligence (OSINT) techniques through a mix of real-world investigation and cybersecurity puzzles. Starting from a physical location within the college, participants follow clues that take them on various online and offline trails involving web research, digital footprints, and hidden leads. All paths lead to a thrilling three-way finale where participants’ choices determine how they find a missing person. This event provides students with a fun, interactive way to build foundational OSINT and cybersecurity skills while offering management a well-rounded, technically relevant learning experience.
 
 Team size: 1-4

fields.shortDescription: In this challenge, teams of 3 receive a fixed budget to buy materials from our store. Their goal: build a bridge to cross a gap and a structure to support maximum load. Complete mini-challenges to earn more budget, but you must optimize your time!
fields.longDescription: we provide each participating team with a fixed budget, which they can spend on materials that we have in store and use to build a bridge to cross a gap and a structure that can take the maximum load. Participants are also given a chance to complete some small challenges to get more budget for materials. They now must optimize time spent on challenges materials and the time spent on constructing the bridge . Team of 3 will take on this challenge

fields.eventName: Personal Finance Workshop for Young Adults
fields.shortDescription: A 4–5 hour interactive workshop for 18–23-year-olds covering budgeting, cash flow, banking, CIBIL scores, SIPs, mutual funds, taxes, and insurance. Hands-on exercises and a 30-day action plan help build financial skills, habits, and independence.
fields.longDescription:
The Personal Finance Workshop for Young Adults is a 4–5 hour interactive session designed to equip students and early-career individuals (ages 18–23) with essential money-management skills that schools and colleges often overlook. Through engaging activities, games, and practical worksheets, participants will learn how to budget effectively, manage cash flow, understand banking and digital finance in India, build and improve their CIBIL scores, explore beginner-friendly investment options like SIPs and mutual funds, and grasp the basics of taxation and insurance. The workshop also focuses on developing positive financial habits, with a 30-day action plan to put concepts into practice. By the end, attendees will gain not just financial knowledge but also actionable strategies, confidence, and a clear roadmap to take charge of their money and build long-term financial independence.

fields.shortDescription: Inspired by an award-winning game, Obscur 33: Final Trace is a story-driven cybersecurity competition. It reimagines the CTF as an immersive, multi-ending experience where you solve dynamic flags and learn cybersecurity through cinematic gameplay.
fields.longDescription: Inspired by an award-winning game, Obscur 33: Final Trace is a story-driven cybersecurity competition. It reimagines the CTF as an immersive, multi-ending experience where you solve dynamic flags and learn cybersecurity through cinematic gameplay.

fields.shortDescription: The teams have to train a model that will perform best for the given dataset, the event will have 2 rounds, 1st round will be to familiarize the teams and will of carry minimum weightage and the second round will carry the rest of the points and based on metrics for the ML model the winner will be chosen

fields.shortDescription: A SolidWorks/Fusion 360 event with a hands-on workshop on Day 1 and a design on Day 2. The 24 hr hackathon helps participants get the hang of CSWA & CSWP exam-taking, with a chance to win CSWA/CWSP coupons and a ₹10,000 cash prize pool.
fields.longDescription: A SolidWorks/Fusion 360 event with a hands-on workshop on Day 1 and a design on Day 2. The 24 hr hackathon helps participants get the hang of CSWA & CSWP exam-taking, with a chance to win CSWA/CWSP coupons and a ₹10,000 cash prize pool.

fields.shortDescription: Quiz-based competition testing tech knowledge, problem-solving, and emerging technology awareness. Teams answer progressively challenging questions, fostering collaboration, quick thinking, and competitive spirit.
fields.longDescription: Brainware is an exciting quiz-based competition that brings a technological twist to the classic Kaun Banega Crorepati format. Participants will tackle rounds of progressively challenging questions spanning computer science, emerging technologies, logical problem-solving, and general tech knowledge. The event is designed to test technical expertise, quick thinking, and strategic decision-making in an engaging and competitive setup. Scheduled to be held on any one day of TechnoVIT, with a maximum team size of 2 members, Brainware promotes collaboration and knowledge sharing, making it a fun, intellectually stimulating highlight of TechnoVIT.

fields.shortDescription: Participants navigate a multi-round event: exploring the campus to solve clues, debugging Python code snippets, competing in fun games, and popping balloons with riddles or tasks. Teams earn points each round, and the highest scorer wins.
fields.longDescription:
Event Rounds Description
Round 1: Campus Hunting
Participants will explore the campus to solve clues and find hidden locations. This round tests
observation, teamwork, and problem-solving skills. The fastest teams to complete the hunt will
move on to the next round.
Round 2: Debugging in Python
Participants will be given Python code snippets containing errors. The task is to debug and correct
the code within the given time limit. This round evaluates programming knowledge, logic, and
accuracy.
Round 3: Fun Games
This round will consist of 4 short and exciting fun games. They are designed to bring energy,
laughter, and friendly competition among participants. Performance in these games will also
contribute to overall scores.
Round 4: Balloon Pop Game
In the final round, balloons filled with chits containing riddles or tasks will be placed. Each team
pops a balloon and must solve the riddle or complete the task within the time limit. Correct answers
or successful attempts earn points. The team with the highest score at the end is declared the
winner. This round is fun, fast, and decisive.

fields.shortDescription: Gear up for Robotics Racing! Claim the ultimate robotics champion title!
fields.longDescription: Gear up for Robotics Racing! Claim the ultimate robotics champion title!

fields.shortDescription: Dive into the future with Drone VR! Experience the thrill of piloting drones in immersive virtual reality. Test your reflexes, precision, and control as you race through stunning digital skies and futuristic arenas.
fields.longDescription: Dive into the future with Drone VR! Experience the thrill of piloting drones in immersive virtual reality. Test your reflexes, precision, and control as you race through stunning digital skies and futuristic arenas.

fields.shortDescription: Get ready to witness the thrill of speed and precision as cutting-edge technology takes flight! Fast reflexes and skill decide who takes the sky! Drone Racing
fields.longDescription: Whether you’re a drone enthusiast, a tech innovator, or just a thrill-seeker, this event promises an adrenaline rush like no other. Experience the perfect blend of aerodynamics, innovation, and competitive spirit - where every millisecond counts!

fields.shortDescription: Get hands-on experience with robotic metal additive manufacturing. In this session, you'll use a robotic arc wire direct energy deposition setup to manufacture your own product. Perfect for students who want to create their own custom metal parts.
fields.longDescription: Get hands-on experience with robotic metal additive manufacturing. In this session, you'll use a robotic arc wire direct energy deposition setup to manufacture your own product. Perfect for students who want to create their own custom metal parts.

fields.clubName: ASME STUDENT CHAPTER X Team Enthalpy
fields.shortDescription: It is a design workshop competition based on rocketry and orbital mechanics using a popular software Kerbal Space Programme.
fields.longDescription: It is a design workshop competition based on rocketry and orbital mechanics using a popular software Kerbal Space Programme.

fields.shortDescription: A genAI workshop featuring a session by ManageEngine (Zoho) on AI in security, followed by a hands-on session where students explore genAI for general and industry use cases, including MCP server creation.
fields.longDescription: A GenAI workshop featuring an interactive session by industry experts from ManageEngine (Zoho) on GenAI in security domains, followed by a hands-on session by students exploring general applications, industry use cases, and MCP server creation.

fields.shortDescription: A solo racing challenge on F1 25 where each participant first answers 10 rapid-fire technical questions. Every wrong answer adds +1 second penalty to their lap time. The fastest adjusted lap wins combining racing thrill with technical knowledge.
fields.longDescription: A solo racing challenge on F1 25 where each participant first answers 10 rapid-fire technical questions. Every wrong answer adds +1 second penalty to their lap time. The fastest adjusted lap wins combining racing thrill with technical knowledge.

fields.shortDescription: The two-day Startup Conclave inspires and guides students in entrepreneurship. Day 1 features interactive sessions with speakers sharing journeys and strategies. Day 2 focuses on startup pitches judged by experts, concluding with a prize distribution.
fields.longDescription:
The Startup Conclave is a two-day event focused on inspiring and guiding students in their entrepreneurial journeys.
Day 1: Innovation & Insight : This day will feature motivational and interactive sessions with three renowned speakers. They will share their personal stories of turning ideas into successful ventures, detailing the challenges, strategies, and key milestones they encountered.
Day 2 : Pitch : This day will focus on the practical application of entrepreneurial skills. Following two final speaker sessions, a dedicated startup pitching event will take place. This provides a platform for student startups to present their ideas to a panel of judges, investors, and industry experts. The event will culminate with a prize distribution ceremony to recognize and reward innovative ideas.

fields.shortDescription: The two-day Startup Conclave inspires and guides students in entrepreneurship. Day 1 features interactive sessions with speakers sharing journeys and strategies. Day 2 focuses on startup pitches judged by experts, concluding with a prize distribution.
fields.longDescription:
The Startup Conclave is a two-day event focused on inspiring and guiding students in their entrepreneurial journeys.
Day 1: Innovation & Insight : This day will feature motivational and interactive sessions with three renowned speakers. They will share their personal stories of turning ideas into successful ventures, detailing the challenges, strategies, and key milestones they encountered.
Day 2 : Pitch : This day will focus on the practical application of entrepreneurial skills. Following two final speaker sessions, a dedicated startup pitching event will take place. This provides a platform for student startups to present their ideas to a panel of judges, investors, and industry experts. The event will culminate with a prize distribution ceremony to recognize and reward innovative ideas.

fields.shortDescription: In this 24-hour hackathon, teams will design medical AI systems using Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG). Leverage medical literature to build solutions, deploy them as APIs, and compete based on accuracy, evidence citation, and reliability.
fields.longDescription:
Hack A Cure is a 24-hour hackathon where participants design advanced medical AI systems using Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG). Teams leverage extensive medical literature to integrate large language models with external knowledge sources, creating AI solutions that provide accurate, context-rich clinical insights.
 
 Participants deploy their solutions as APIs, which are assessed through automated medical query tests measuring accuracy, evidence citation, and reliability. The hackathon emphasizes developing AI tools that enhance diagnostics, improve patient outcomes, and reduce AI hallucinations.
 
 Beyond technical innovation, Hack A Cure offers hands-on experience with cutting-edge AI technologies, including vector and graph databases, preparing participants for real-world challenges in medical AI applications. The event fosters creativity, collaboration, and ethical AI development, showcasing the potential of retrieval-augmented generation in healthcare.
 
 By combining AI, data retrieval, and medical expertise, Hack A Cure equips students and professionals with practical skills to design robust, evidence-based AI systems, advancing the future of intelligent healthcare solutions.

fields.shortDescription: In this challenge, teams of 2 have 45 minutes to build a catapult using only provided materials. The objective is to launch projectiles and knock down targets. Points are awarded for accuracy, power, and creative design, with penalties for delays.
fields.longDescription:
The Angry Bird Stem event is a hands-on building and targeting challenge. 
 Objective: Participants must design and build a miniature catapult that can launch projectiles to knock down the target. Accuracy and distance both matter.
 Competition: Team of 2 people. All the teams compete with each other. Each and every team will be given 45 mins to build and design their own catapult and launch. Points will be awarded for hitting the target, knocking them down, creative design and if they do not finish it on time their points will be reduced. The team with the highest score or fastest completion wins.
 Rules: Participants can only use the materials provided by the club. Creativity in building and designing the catapult is encouraged. Safety must be maintained while launching projectiles

fields.eventName: Decoding Time  A Journey into TIME SERIES ANALYSIS
fields.shortDescription: This workshop provides a gentle intro on the applications which requires time series analysis and hands-on session on - Introduction to time-series and stationary data handling, data smoothing, autocorrelation, and AutoRegressive Integrated Moving Average (ARIMA) models and handling the Temporal data imbalance in Python,
fields.longDescription: This workshop provides a gentle intro on the applications which requires time series analysis and hands-on session on - Introduction to time-series and stationary data handling, data smoothing, autocorrelation, and AutoRegressive Integrated Moving Average (ARIMA) models and handling the Temporal data imbalance in Python,

fields.shortDescription: Participants build standout personal portfolio websites using AI tools and coding. Projects are judged on design, functionality, responsiveness, and presentation. Attendees gain skills to create impressive, professional portfolios from scratch.
fields.longDescription: A dynamic workshop and contest where you build standout personal portfolio websites fast. Learn to harness AI tools and code from scratch to create portfolios that grab attention. Projects will be judged on design, functionality, responsiveness, and presentation. Attendees will gain walkaway with the ability to build impressive portfolios.

fields.shortDescription: Workshop on innovation and IPR with a hackathon. Sessions include: innovation introduction, IPR basics, ideation, creative problem-solving, group hackathon activity, and presentations. Participants learn to implement ideas effectively.
fields.longDescription:
Objective:
• To educate students about intellectual property rights (IPR) and their role in innovation.
• To inspire students to generate creative solutions to real-world problems.
• To provide a platform where students can implement their ideas through a hackathon - Group activity

Tentative Sessions:

Session 1: Introduction to Innovation (FN session)

Session 2: Understanding intellectual property rights (IPR) (FN session)

Session 3: Ideation & Creativity (FN session)

Session 4: Hackathon - Group activity - Creative solutions to real-world problems (FN & AN session)

Session 5: Presentation (AN session)
